intro: Hippocrepis montgronyana, commonly known as the Montgronyan scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in dry, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
